page.title: 02HISTORY & DEVELOPMENT
page.content: Being the property of the Prince Bishop of Durham,the area was not covered by the Domesday book,but by the Boldon Book of 1183,where West Auckland is described.The village of St.Helen Auckland grew up after the building of the 12th.century church of St.Helen.The name Auckland is derived from'Oak-land',for an oak forest orig- inally covered this district.West Auckland is built around a large vill- age green,whilst the oldest buildings in St.Helen Auckland are adjacent to the church,with the Elizabethan Old Hall Farm (now derelect) nearby.Most of the buildings in the villages date from the early 19th.century to the present day.The Stockton & Darlington Railway,passing through the area, triggered development by the consequ- ent upsurge in coal mining.
